headline: Billionaire Ray Dalio Backs 15% Allocation to Bitcoin and Gold Amid U.S. Debt Spiral
China's Bitmain to launch first U.S. factory amid political tailwinds
summary:
Bitmain to Launch First U.S. Factory Amid Political Tailwinds

Bitmain Technologies, the world’s largest crypto mining hardware maker, plans to open its first U.S. facility by late Q3 2025, with a new headquarters and assembly site in either Texas or Florida.

Production is expected to begin in early 2026, with full operations later that year and an initial 250 local hires. The move aligns with Trump’s push to expand Bitcoin mining in the U.S., and follows trade tensions that disrupted Bitmain’s supply chains and led to the blacklisting of its AI affiliate.

The U.S. has become the global hub for crypto mining, with Trump’s sons launching American Bitcoin Corp. in partnership with Hut 8, which recently ordered over 31,000 Bitmain rigs.

This article was written by Eamonn Sheridan at investinglive.com.
